detailsOfAchievement: Career Education & Technical Society is non profit social organization is working towards the upliftment of educational standards and spreading the cause of education for all, through its various projects in the field of academics, community based education programmes, adult education programmes and income generating training programmes. Career Education & Technical Society formed by its President and Members in December 2006. From 2006 Career Education & Technical Society becomes a famous point for auto cad & other IT Courses training. As society it provides a simpler and more targeted framework to validate core technical skills, professional skills, and architectural skills. It also provides professional in the IT industry with a more relevant, flexible, and cost-effective way to showcase their skills. Career Education & Technical Society was founded by a group of professionals whose excellence in computer-based training is worth to vouch for. A group, who has made it one of the largest training centres in North India.

detailsOfAchievement: Ch. Sher Singh Memorial Shanti Devi Charitable Trust was registred with GOVT. of HR on 24/10/2006.. Trust was established by Sh. Pradeep Singh Deswal S/O Sh. Umed Singh Deswal Residentl of C â€“ 146 Carlton Estate DLF Gurgaon with Following Trustees: â€¢ DR Subhash Nain S/O Sh. Dewan Singh R/O C â€“ 1039 Sushant Lok â€“ 1. Who is a Renowned Social worker MSW having an Experience OF more than 10 year in this area. â€¢ DR VP Ahlawat S/O Sh. Sher Singh R/O 20 /Sec. 15 A is a highly acclaimed Horticulturist Since Last 30 years . Dr Suresh Alhawat S/O Sh. Sher Singh R/O 1039 Sushant Lok -1 is a Doctor By Profession with an Experience of More than 20 Years Having a Strong Social inclination. According to its Objectives This Trust has been actively involved in multifactorial Social Works from Very beginning . Some of its activities have been widely Acclaimed and Published in Media . Dr- Suresh Ahlawat managing trustee has been honoured by Chief Minister of Haryana State for Trust activities. Since Apr.2011 the Trust is running a Charitable Dental Clinic in the Name of Shanti Dental at village Jharsa Where Free Treatment is given to Patients from BPL Category Various Health Camps have been Organized by Trust ,For Police Pesonal , School children ,senior citizens. A Week long Acclaimed Dental awareness programme was held witha SCPCR in May 2013 in various govt schools of Gurgaon.A dental and eye check up & treatment camp was organized with the help of an NGO in a school for low income group children. A medical and dental program was organized involving general check up,eye check up, and skin check up by the trust with the help of RWA Park place gurgaon on 21st March 2016 with activie involvement of health department of Haryana.A General health check up camp was organized at village lajwana khurd in association with health department haryana on 3rd July 2016 and 450 people were benefited from the camp few of the were done eye operation at general hospital rohtak.

detailsOfAchievement: Established in 1980 and registered in 1990, CVS has been involved in various developmental activities in different areas of Health & Family Welfare, STI, RTI, HIV, AIDS, Rural Development, Welfare of the aged, Education (Non-Formal Education, Vocational Education and Training), Women & Child Development, Women Empowerment, Self Help Group Formation and Awareness Generation Activities. Major activities undertaken for last years are following : -CVS successfully completed the implementation of IEC Scheme of Indian System of Medicine & Homeopathy in Meham Block of Rohtak District of Haryana with financial support of Ministry of Health & Family Welfare Deptt. of Indian System of Medicine & Homeopathy through SOSVA, New Delhi - CVS has successfully completed Promotion of Small Family Norms & Population Control By Encouraging Adoption of Spacing Methods supporting by SCOVA, IPP-VII (World Bank Project) - CVS has successfully completed the Project Promotion of Spacing Methods in Newly Married & Couples with less than two Children with financial assistance from Min. of H &FW, Govt. of India under PVOH-II (Private Voluntary Organization for Health) -CVS is successfully implementing project of Rural Building Centre at Meham with financial assistance from Ministry of Rural Development through HUDCO, New Delhi -CVS is successfully running One Day Care Centre for the Aged at Bhaini Surjan Village of District Rohtak with financial support from Ministry of Social Justice & Empowerment, Govt. of India for last ten years. - CVS has successfully completed Swa-shakti Project in Alewa Block of Jind Distt. with financial support from Haryana Women Development Corporation, Chandigarh under Haryan Rural Women Development & Empowerment Project (HRWDEP). - CVS has been successfully running an Old Age Home at Meham both for male and female which provides Library, Health check-up, Referral, Nutrition, Outing/Visit, Accommodation, Access to Information and Entertainment Services to more than 25 aged with financial support from Ministry of Social Justice & Empowerment, Govt. of India. -CVS has successfully carried out Awareness Generation Programme among NFE Children on Bio Diversity Conservation with financial support from CEE Delhi under Darwin Initiatives.

This year on as Skill India is celebrating its anniversary, Ministry of Skill Development and Entrepreneurship has today got an approval from the Cabinet on Pradhan Mantri Kaushal Vikas Yojana 2016-2020, which aims at skilling to one crore people over next four years (April 2016 to March 2020) with an outlay of Rs.12, 000 crore. detailsOfAchievement: National Child Relief ServicesÂ plays an important part in protecting the global environment as well. A lot of awareness is created amongst the Indian people on deadly diseases like Heart Disease, Cancer, etc. for which camps are set up and run all over the India from time to time. Children living in the slums are also provided nutritious food, medicines and clothing free of cost. The other objective of the Trust is the instituting of Secondary, Primary and Middle level schools for offering free education to the poor and street children. All the support and indoctrination required are offered byÂ National Child Relief ServicesÂ while addressing epidemics related to AIDs and HIV. To agencies in the private sector, governments of developing nations and non-government organizations, the Trust provides white-collar and technical assistance as well as all-embracing training. The Trust also designs, manages and evaluates all-inclusive prevention of HIV and AIDS, offers support and care sequencers and also provides answerability in management of finances and the results of the programs, both. title: National HRD Network
actName: Section 29 of the Bombay Public Trust Act, 1950
detailsOfAchievement: The National HRD Network (NHRDN), established in 1986, is the leading National Apex body of HR professionals committed to promoting the HRD movement in the country and enhancing the capability of human resource professionals to global levels, while simultaneously enabling them to make an impactful contribution in enhancing competitiveness and creating value for Society. Over the past three decades, this institution has been built and mentored by outstanding leaders and committed office bearers who have embraced the mission of creating an unparalleled network of Human Resource professionals who can contribute meaningfully and in a value-added manner to the process of organization and nation building. NHRDN has approximately 12500 Professional Members and more than 1200 Corporate Institutional Members, with an all-India network of 30 chapters, and has global linkages with institutions like the Ross Business School, University of Michigan USA, Wharton Business School USA, Fudan University China, Society of Human Resource Management (SHRM) USA, and many others.
